text:
Whilst preparing the patches, I noticed two files that don't seem to belong in SVN:


tc4.1.x/connectors/ajp/proxy/config.m4.patch
servletapi/src/share/dtd/web-app_2_3.dtd.backup

Patches to follow
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Note that there are still a lot of DTD and JSP files to do.
It was not clear to me if all the DTDs are ASF files or if some are 3rd party.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
You have attached the connectors patch twice, rather than the container patch.

The spec related DTDs are mostly third party that we need to leave alone.

creator: markt@apache.org
text: In fact for 4.x, anything in servlet API can (should?) be left as is.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #7)
> In fact for 4.x, anything in servlet API can (should?) be left as is.
> 

Apart from build.xml, which is the only file patched ...

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 22900
One more container file to patch

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 22901
RAT output listing after applying all patches

The RAT listing is attached.

I've excluded quite a few files (pcre, servletapi, VC files).

The main remaining files are .shtml and .jsp, both of which should probably have AL headers added.

creator: markt@apache.org
text: Thanks for the patches they have been applied to tc4. Note that the connectors patches apply to tc5 as well since they share the code.
